channel.title: Limewire
channel.description:
R.I.P. Limewire, you will be missed. :(
EDIT: I have new infomation, Limewire the company that developed Limewire has shutdown but Limewire the pear to pear software is still running pear to pear, so don't expect new vesions to come out.
live on Limewire!!

item.title: Limewire
item.dc:creator: @revengr revengr
item.description:
@revengr wrote:

[s]I just rip all my music from youtube videos.
You don’t really have to worry about viruses that way.
video2mp3.net

I’ll check out frostwire.[/s]

Lol fuck that I’m using frostwire.

Read full topic

item.description:
@ziplock wrote:

Good. Maybe people will start seeding all my damn torrents now.

Read full topic

item.title: Limewire
item.dc:creator: @Svitkona Svitkona
item.description:
@Svitkona wrote:

They should put this when you open Limewire/any P2P software:

                              ***Warning***
This program is for l33t downloads only. Common sense required for usage.
If no common sense is used, "Program Name" reserves the right to sue you
for extreme idiocy and being a waste on Earth and tainting perfectly good
                                                 Oxygen.


                                                                         Thank you,
                                                                                *signature here*

@above: this is the shit.

Read full topic

[quote=“Lin, post:45, topic:366266”]You’re all idiots if you don’t use LimeWire because of the viruses. If you can’t tell if a 2KB file called “JOBROS NEW ALBUM #1 UK US 2010-09 JONAS HIT 1 NUMBER” is a virus then you don’t even deserve to use a computer to begin with.[/quote]Most common viruses are over 2kb

I’ll check this Frostwire crap out…
[/quote]

frostwire is an ripped client from limwire pro.
ITS ALL THE SAME CONNECTION . lilmwire death - Frostwire death.
start searching for other things.[/quote]
Frostwire is working.

item.title: Limewire
item.dc:creator: @iCreatedHorror Ryan
item.description:
@iCreatedHorror wrote:

Limewire for awhile wasn’t ‘technically’ illegal, as they didn’t host the files.
But apparently they did add something illegal, hence the shutdown/lawsuit.

Basing this off of my mom, a lawyer.

Read full topic

item.title: Limewire
item.dc:creator: @reverce reverce
item.description:
@reverce wrote:

[quote=“Fat Cookies, post:22, topic:366266”][quote author=Scape-JAVA link=topic=462466.msg3383304#msg3383304 date=1288226479]
I use to use it but it had to many viruses I use frostwire now.
[/quote]
ahahahaha, don’t you realize that frostwire simply took the open source code to limewire pro, changed the name and compiled it. It is the exact same software and connects to the exact same network which contains the exact same viruses

As I have mentioned before I absolutely hate the gnutella network and i’m actually glad that limewire has been taken down. There are so many other and better ways to get media!

I do wonder what frostwire will do now, whether they’ll just keep the client as it is, or continue to develop it on their own.[/quote]

same connection as limewire , limwire death = frostwire death.

Read full topic

item.title: Limewire
item.dc:creator: @whip_of_soulz whip of soulz
item.description:
@whip_of_soulz wrote:

[quote=“CoonHunter, post:31, topic:366266”][quote author=BigWhoop link=topic=462466.msg3384079#msg3384079 date=1288300961]
Limewire was a Scam/Virus in the first place…

I’m VERY happy it has been ownt.
[/quote]
Scam? I remember the option of NOT paying dude. As for viruses, you should have an anti-virus that works? Ive only ever gotten 2 viruses out of the 100’s of things i downloaded via Limewire before finding torrents.[/quote]Not all viruses are detected.

Read full topic
